titles.title: Social Security Continuing Disability Review Account Act of 1995

To amend title II of the Social Security Act to establish a Continuing Disability Review Account in the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund which shall be available solely for expenditures necessary to carry out continuing disability reviews.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 5/9/1995--Introduced. Social Security Continuing Disability Review Account Act of 1995 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to create in the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund a Continuing Disability Review Account as a mechanism for funding continuing disability reviews (CDRs) out of a portion of the savings derived from conducting such reviews. Requires Account operations to be reflected in the Secretary of Health and Human Services' annual report to the Congress on CDRs.
